page.title: 17Public Attitudes to Housing
page.content: Most people interviewed were pleased with the condition of their housing, of which most were council houses, but thought that rent and rates were far too high. Some people did complain about the length of time it took for repairs to be done. There was a great difference in opinion about leisure facilities. Some were happy, others were not (especially concerning facil- ities for youth). The most popular of these were Church groups and garden- ing. Sport is very popular with the youth of this area. Attitudes towards the neighbourhood differed according to the area you were in. Most people were satisfied, but others strongly disliked the area in which they lived. People passing through seemed to give the area a lot of trouble, although the people who lived there were very nice.
